see here

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2025-05-15T16:27:24.803Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":372,"readers_count":371,"score":79.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":501780,"topic_slug":"maxswerve-with-minion-steering-motor","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/neo-550s-urge-to-smoke/469824","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Neo 550s' Urge to Smoke","clicks":69}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":24295,"username":"JacobD","name":"JacobD","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jacobd/{size}/193820_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":75183,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/maxswerve-with-minion-steering-motor/501780/6","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3625310,"name":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","username":"ngreen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ngreen/{size}/264478_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-15T16:29:06.819Z","cooked":"

So, is there an adapter between the SplineXS on the Minion and the 13 tooth pinion input for the Ultraplanetary slice? Or what is this setup?

No, we haven’t smoked any NEO 550s on the MaxSwerve in the 3 years running them. Also, they ran pretty well all year with minimal changes to the swerve template.

I would think the Kraken should fit where the Vortex but don’t know for certain.

Paul_R:

would this theoretically let you run CTRE swerve gen Maxswerve?

You can already do this if you use the Neo 550 on a TalonFXS

Is that a part you can buy somewhere? I don’t think 3d printing it is going to work well, unless you can print in metal.

And who might make such a thing?

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2025-05-15T17:42:35.102Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":274,"readers_count":273,"score":104.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":501780,"topic_slug":"maxswerve-with-minion-steering-motor","display_username":"Mark Wasserman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":75183,"username":"khoang26","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/848f3c/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":30473,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Not fast swerve, but good swerve driven quickly"},"post_url":"/t/maxswerve-with-minion-steering-motor/501780/12","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3625416,"name":"Ben Edwards","username":"beedward","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/beedward/{size}/111315_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-15T18:26:44.012Z","cooked":"

If you were truly desperate to try this, I think you could make it work by disassembling an Ultraplanetary stage, then combining its output carrier with some of the WCP SplineXS to 3d print adapters and a 3d printed plastic interface.
It would be ugly and clunky.

image618×509 44.7 KB

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2025-05-15T18:26:44.012Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":261,"readers_count":260,"score":102.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":501780,"topic_slug":"maxswerve-with-minion-steering-motor","display_username":"Ben Edwards","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":30473,"username":"Mark_Wasserman","name":"Mark Wasserman","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mark_wasserman/{size}/9677_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":37435,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"EE mentor"},"post_url":"/t/maxswerve-with-minion-steering-motor/501780/13","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3625444,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-15T18:51:09.818Z","cooked":"

The damage there is caused by pre-existing damage (a broken feedback wire) rather than burning up due to a typical swerve load.

I also haven’t seen a 550 fail in swerve either.

I don’t know exactly how you were thinking to manufacture that, especially if it’s one part.

If solid SplineXS stock was a thing and you had a lathe, you could turn the end of a length to 0.125" and press a UP 550 pinion on. Then use a gear or the SplineXS hex adapter (WCP-1118) as a “coupler”.

You could turn the end of some threaded rod to 0.125", press the pinion on, and thread/green loctite it into the end of the minion shaft (I don’t know if it’s a good idea to rely on the threaded connection for torque transmission, I’d guess probably not).

@beedward 's idea is probably the best. Solving this is the main difficulty of adapting the minion/kraken x44 for MaxSwerve.

Mark_Wasserman:

Actually, I am that desperate.

Hope that doesn’t mean 2767 is ditching the 3rd coast drive.

Max_Morehead:

Hope that doesn’t mean 2767 is ditching the 3rd coast drive.

Max_Morehead:

If solid SplineXS stock was a thing

This is now a thing, since the center of these thrifty bot shafts appear to be solid, so I would think this would be the cleanest way to adapt SplineXS for UP if you have a lathe.

The Thrifty Bot

Pre-Order: SplineXS Shafts

Steel SplineXS shafts. Primarily used with the Thrifty Cycloidal gearbox. Stub shafts include 10-32 threaded holes for a 3/8" long bolt.

Price: USD 9.99
